review: i can just tell you right now that T3 is the best movie ever.it puts Matrix reloaded look very bad I cant wait for T4 T5 T6 the action is the best thing THATS A VERY GOOD DEAL

title: Exciting summer flick
review: I just saw the Matrix Reloaded. It was humorless, pseudo-intellectual, needlessly complicated, and the fight scenes were tensionless and too long. I didn't like it. So it was nice to see T3 was the exact opposite. Though it started out a little slowly, there were plenty of humorous moments, the plot was simple (supposedly there were continuity issues with the other movies, but even though I saw T2 twice, I didn't notice), the actions scenes were well done, and there were even moments of real emotion. As long as you accept T3 for what it is -- an action movie with no depth -- you will thoroughly enjoy it.

title: Wonderful
review:
I personally liked this movie a lot. The chase scene leaves everything behind in the dust, including The French Connection. SFX are good and not over the top like other movies. I never thought Hollywood would ever come up with such a good ending, other directors should take great notice of this and learn. The cast is very good and the focus of the film is on John Connor and not on his mom like the two first ones were (T2 to a lesser extent) and it is truly a new chapter in the series. Furlong is not missed. Kristanna is doing a great job, she ain't something you wanna' play with :-D Clair and Nick are truly actors of high caliber and the bottom line is that Arnold is VERY good. The blend with occasional light hearted dialog in a very somber movie is great, it would have been too heavy otherwise.

I WANT MORE!

title: Outstanding!
review: T3 is by far the most satisfying action film I have seen this year. Nonstop mayhem from  beginning to end with very little time between action sequences to catch your breath. A very  well done continuation of the Terminator saga. Not having James Cameron's heavy hand on  this one was probably the best thing that could have happened. It made the story feel fresh  again. I highly recommend this film.

title: T1 and T2 were Sci-fi landmarks but...
review:
when treated as a stand alone, T3 is a highly entertaining film.

Ah-nold is still doing his thing in a major way. Here's hoping that the storywriters keep the twists and surprising with the indomitable Terminator. Kristanna Loken is a knockout. Her coldness and mercilessness is memorable. Nick Stahl and Clare Danes are engrossing actors. Stahl reminds me of Michael Biehn and Danes of a young Linda Hamilton. All in all, the acting is very good.

title: Awesome sequel!!
review:
All I can say is that this movie kicked ass! Probably the best of the 5 summer movies I have seen so far.

However, If you guys own the Ultimate Edition DVD of T-2, watching the Special Edition cut with the extra scenes featuring the Sarah Connor character as an old woman will not make this 3rd part make sense.

Overall, fantastic sequel....A-....Looking forward to the conclusion.

title: Awesome! Intense ! A must see 4 stars out of 4.
review:
My wife and I have just seen T3 rise of the machines and we were absolutely blown away by this 3rd installment of the Terminator Saga.

At first I had wondered whether the absence of James Cameron as the director would be felt but I can honestly say now, that the T3 story and character development was superbly well done by Jonathan Mostow who has earned my respect as the director of T3.

The progression of the events in the film is particularly gripping and intense especially when one understands everything that has led up to the events that take place in T3. All the pieces seem to come together at a whirlwind pace and many questions are answered from the first 2 movies.

The action sequences are first-rate, outstanding and compelling. The dynamic interplay and chemistry displayed by the four main characters T101, the TX, John and Kate is fascinating to watch.

I highly recommend this film, which is not only non-stop action but also full of emotional depth and eye opening perspectives which characterizes great science fiction stories. I am extremely demanding of science fictions stories having been a hard core Sci-Fi fan all my life and this film passes the test with flying colors.This trilogy will take its rightful place alongside my other favorite Sci-Fi sagas such as the Alien series.

title: WATCH THIS MOVIE!!!!
review: When I heard they were making another terminator movie, I didn't know what to expect. After seeing this movie though, I was really impressed. I honestly believe this movie is very good. Yes some of the jokes were really lame, like the talk to the hand thing, but many other complaints people have with the movie are unjustified. People have been complaining that Nick Stahl acted "lost" in the movie. Yet that was an element of his character. Even Arnold who's now around 60 was great. Claire Danes who doesn't do many action movies was wonderful in the movie. Not to mention Loken, who is amazing, acted her part pretty well. I'm not arguing that this movie is the best terminator. Yes we all know that Cameron is a great director, but Mostow is one too. The action and story are amazing. People have been complaining about how the movie doesn't require enough thought, but seriously the third time around I think everyone understands the concept by now. There wasn't much need to explain the war. Terminator 2 did that great. This movie is an excellent movie that I believe will make an excellent addition to the terminator series. My only concern is that in order to milk the franchise, future movies will begin to suck. Let's just hope I'm wrong. WATCH THIS MOVIE!!!!

title: Great action, tried too hard to come up with a funny line.
review: Lots of action, always like new characters, especially hot ones. One of the few amusing scenes occurred in the beginning.There's a cliff hanger of an ending, so i'm sure they'll be a T4 in a few years. If you liked the previous terminators, it's worth the price of a ticket.

title: AMAZING !!!!!!!!!!
review:
I have just experienced the best action scenes I have ever seen. The story is perfect and exceeded by far my expectations.

Note: If you have not seen T1 & T2 you will be lost. And if you have, you are going to love this one. Have not seen T3 yet ? What are you waiting for ?

title: Not a worthy sequel.
review:
T3 is more of an attempt to simply do a sequel for money. The plot line is fairly convoluted and seems more like the second part in a trilogy.

Arnold is simply Arnold. He is okay, the action is as expected, lines seems more forced and the writing is not as witty as T2. Nick Stahl seems more like a TV actor and doesn't have the anger that Eddie Furlong portrayed in T2. Claire Danes does a decent job as his future spouse. Kristanna Loken as T-X is a little confusing as a character and a Terminator. Is she an improvement? She has more mechanical breakdowns than the T-1000 series. She is a babe. She tries to be icy like Robert Patrick did in T2, but to me she needs more training.

My major beef about the movie is some obvious script flaws. Claire's father is in charge of an secret Air Force research lab and she along with John Conner and Arnold manage to simply waltz into this facility without even a glitch, loaded with weapons and explosives. Good security, especially in the times we live in now.

The other downer is the end. How can the future be written in stone. I find this extremely unbelievable that not one thing all these people do, doesn't appear to change one thing in the future time line.

I wish James Cameron was involved with this project. He is a much better writer/director for this type of genre.

title: Terminator 3 appeals to long time fans and newcomers as well, this was a great movie.
review:
Now im not going to give any of the movie away, because it will not be nearly as good if i do. T3 definitly takes a step up from T2 and T1 in the special effects department. Some of the special effects were absolutely breathtaking. The TX (Lokken)was brilliant as she acted so much like a machine i almost thought that she was! she has very few lines so for most of the movie, she uses facial expressions. She is also very...evil. within the first 20 minutes of the movie she kills quite a few people. Arnold comes back strong as the somewhat primitive Terminator Model-101. Again, like T2 he is greatly at the disadvantage. I think Arnold played the terminator better in T3 then he did in any of the other ones. He seemed a lot more like a machine.

As for Nick Stahl playing John Connor, when i first heard that he was replacing Edward Furlong i was really angry. Furlong was the original John Connor, not to mention hes a great actor. He would have been perfect to play Connor again. But i was pleasantly suprised, Nick Stahl played the part great, and you got the feel that he was very nervous, and unstable about judgement day and his destiny from the first moment you saw him. Kathryn Brewster(Claire Danes)is Connors supporting character and Danes does a much better job then i thought she was going to do. All in All, the acting was very well done.

The plot had some holes in it but not too bad. I think that they could have cleared a few things up. However, the ending stole the entire movie. I was completely stunned at the end, and it was very unpredictable....i had NO clue it was even coming.

All in All, definitly worth the $9.00, maybe another $9.00 if i want to go again.....i urge everyone to go see this movie, it was great

8.5/10

title: Decent action flick...
review:
...but not worthy as a successor to T2.

Great action sequences, big explosions, great chases, and even a little self depricating humor. i liked that. there was only one scene that i felt was overly contrived. overall, it held my attention and kept the adrenaline pumping from start to finish. Arnold looked great.

but the plot was average and somehow just wasn't as intelligent as T2. i know I'm not supposed to expect intelligence from an action flick, but i did. The acting was wooden and characters were one sided. I had trouble understanding everyone's motivation. (except for the terminator himself who by definition is one sided, wooden, and motivated). There were also some unexplained idiosyncracies that seemed like the director was going to do something more but then changed his mind. but then at the other extreme, there were some things that were very obvious, but yet were still drilled into us again and again.

overall, a good action flick. but I was expecting more.

title: A great follow up to the Terminator series
review: I have been waiting for this movie ever since I first saw T2 many years ago. Now that I have seen it, I can positively say that this was a really good movie and would even enjoyable to the audience that hasn't been longing for this movie as I have. Although this movie was a bit more comical then the previous movies and there is a noticeable difference between this movie and the others because of the absence of James Cameron, it still holds that true Terminator feeling. My only problem with this movie would be the length, barely and hour and a half, which is an half an hour shorter than the spectacular T2. I do suggest this to any terminator or non-terminator fan, you don't need to know every thing about the story to keep you into like some new movies out right now.

title: Good excuse to destroy vehicles - Average movie
review: The crane scene in this movie makes it worthwhile.  I think they tried too hard to compete with the Matrix and failed.  Either that or I am now expecting a good story to go with special effects and it just didn't happen. They also seemed to be trying too hard to set up T4 - I'd probably skip it based on this one.

title: A Triumph
review:
Well, after being treated to a sneak preview Tuesday night, I must say that this film is not what I originally expected. The odds were against it: No Cameron, no Hamilton, no Eddie Furlong, but lo and behold, T3 is something of a masterpiece. Not a perfect masterpiece, mind you. But one truly worthy of note.

It has been a long time since a Terminator film graced theaters, and many people thought that was due to script rewrites and such, when actually the original Carolco Pictures company went bankrupt sometime after the second film. Legal battles ensued for years, and finally a phoenix rose from the ashes. But enough of this prologue, is it good?

From the unique presentation of the beginning (interwoven clips of the future and present-day footage) to the stirring action sequences (which unfortunately, harbor my only gripe), I was truly amazed with Jonathan Mostow's work. I noticed that one review cited a plot hole: the machines couldn't have reinstituted SkyNet because Arnold and the T-1000 were killed in the first one. Well, one possibility is the arm. Though it is not mentioned in the third installment, we all remember Arnold losing an arm in the second film, which was not destroyed. Totally plausible. There are other criticisms, but that was the most outspoken. My only problems are the action sequences. Yes they're great, and yes, the CG characters used in the scenes look more realistic than the Matrix Reloaded's Neo...but, sometimes there are too many cuts, and you lose track of where the action is. Not enough wide establishing shots, too many closeups. Of course a film is more cost-effective that way.

All in all, great acting, a great script, and amazing special effects make this film enjoyable, but what makes it remarkable is its subtle touch of heart. Go see it, bring your family, and remember Arnold's last words in this movie, "We will meet again." Sequel?

title: Good, though it would've been refined a bit. Terminator 2 remains unsurpassed!
review: The action is great, some of the fight scenes are a lot more brutal than the ones from Terminator 2, and Kristanna Loken really shows her true strength here, besides she plays her part as a cold-blooded cyborg pretty well, and she acts with full strength, though she doesn't talk too much.  Though Kristanna's Cyborg Character would've been more brutal to form, she did a swell job.  Johnathan Mostow did a good job directing this one, though he would've spent more time refining it a bit, and the story would've been a bit better.  James Cameron remains unsurpassed!!!!!

title: Great Movie
review: This is a rare chance to see a decent 3rd installment of a great franchise. T3 had a pretty good plot, great acting, and the same subtle humor that was delivered in T2. T3 isnt as good as T2 (T2 revolutionize action films along with the first matrix) but is better than the first. Great use of CG, i didnt even relieze it was fake. Although some parts of the movie are a drag and some parts can get confusing, ultimatly i would recommend T3 to anyone intrested in a fun action movie with our favorite action man Arnie.

title: Excellent Movie!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: T3 was a delight!!!! It was action packed and everything in the storyline was explained very well. Arnold looked to be in tremendous shape. Many people complain about the TX being a girl, but you really don't even worry about while watching T3. There are bigger issues than her. So, to answer everyone's question: Did it live up to the hype? YES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It was an amazing piece of cinema. I recommend seeing it more than once in the theatres.

title: Not as good as the 1st 2, but still a fun movie
review:
Action and effects were top notch. Typical Arnold, looking good at 50+. Lacked a good story, too many new characters.

Should be interesting if they go for a 4th. How much more invinceable can they make a terminator?

title: Surprise of the summer!!!
review:
For months I've been waiting for the poor test screenings and bad press. For weeks I've been waiting for the bad reviews to being pouring in. For every minute on screen, I was waiting for this movie to fail. It never did! Mostow did a commendable job with a tough act to follow (T2) but he pulls it off with a hugely entertaining, action piece. Not without flaws, mind you but very satisfying nonetheless.

He's my review of the series

T-1 4 out of 5 stars- A classic. A movie that will borrow, change and redefine sci-fi action for years to come.

T-2 4 1/2 out of 5 stars The Grandaddy of all action piece. A perfect blend of story, fx and big screen glory. The best action movie of the last decade

T-3 3 1/2 out of 5 stars Some of the best action scene ever captured on film and it's relentless pace more than make up some plot holes and an under utilized villian. Nothing groundbreaking but a great sequel nonetheless.

title: Not a bad follow up - just not as good as the first two.
review: What had to be the toughest job in making T3 was developing a good enough bad guy.  Surprisingly, that is the best part of T3.  They did it right.  Don't think so?  You try to come up with a better bad guy.  It ain't easy. The action was pretty solid and the movie doesn't waste time getting uncorked.  There are very few slow points to the movie. The plot has holes in it.  So what?  It's good enough to support the action and it's pretty hard to come up with a time travel plot that doesn't have holes in it.  Only Bill and Ted could manage most excellent time travel. Bottom line:   Action was solid, direction was pretty good, the acting wasn't as good as T2 and the music didn't have the drive of either of the first two.  So - - not as good as the first two but definitely worth the admission price.

title: Arnolds ripped and back in black... sweet!
review:
If you haven't seen this movie yet, you owe it to yourself to watch it.

As a big fan of the Terminator series, it's kinda hard to imagine one being made without James Cameron in the director's chair but Jonathan Mostow does a great job.

Terminator movies always have alot of action and this movie isn't any different. The T-X makes a great villain and good enough to surpass the T-1000 in the second movie. She (loosely here) kills her victims almost as ruthlessly as the T-1000.

The story is the most important part of this film and any plot holes that I had were patched up upon second viewing of this movie. It's well written and fits in with the other movies.

This sequel is done with great respects to the previous installments, and if you enjoyed T2 (who didn't?) then you'll enjoy this movie too!

title: Not Bad...But No T2
review:
Terminator 3 was in fact a somewhat enjoyable film, However it as many sequels was extremely flawed. This story brings us To John at the Age 21 or 22 It is not said but we are guesstamating. Judgment Day never came on that Fateful August day in 1997...But yet A new Terminator, The T-X, has been sent back to eliminate John's Lt's and Fighters, Also another T-101 has been sent back to protect John. If you think you have a grasp on the timeline for the Terminator Films Forget it.. The timeline is Skewered Badly. Now what you can look forward to, Great action Sequences, A New Bada$$ and extremely Attractive Female Terminator, And Some new plot twists. Do you have to see T3 now or can You wait for it on DVD. Well.... If you wanna help the film recoup it's massive $170 million dollar budget, By all means spend your $8.00. If you can wait....Which I now wish I had.... The DVD will offer much more than just a mediocre Film.... It will have Interesting Behind The Scenes Footage.

Performances: Nick Stahl *** out of ***** Decent Choice Clair Danes ** Out of ***** Miscast Kristianna Loken *** Out of ***** Decent Arnold Scharwzenegger***Out of ***** Better in T1 & T2

The Film relies too much on action...Not enough on story...And is ridden with humor in all the wrong places. SPOILER SPOILER

When Having Arnold arrive into the current timeline...Don't use a Bar like JC did in T2...Be More original.

WAIT FOR DVD WAIT FOR DVD WAIT FOR DVD WAIT FOR DVD.

title: A little cheesy, but fun the watch!
review:
There are some cheesy scenes, but a few of them are actually pretty funny! I would have changed a few things, but it is still a great action flick.

I believe the plot holes that "cwdfwtx" mentioned, actually originated in the second film: the T-1000 was sent back to kill John because he leads the resistance, not because he stops the war. However, that doesn't explain how they were able to destroy skynet, and I still think T2 was a good movie anyway. Although, I do wish the third movie elaborated on how skynet was able to recover.

It was fun to see how the war began, after being in the dark for 12 years! If there's a fourth: good or bad, I'll see it.

title: All things considered - a real good time
review:
Face it: T2 is as good as moviemaking gets. There's no way to beat it, or even to equal it. Take that attitude, and this movie becomes infinitely better.

First: Arnold. This role is why he is on Earth. Still fits him like a glove.

These action sequences are not bombastic over computerized seizures like Matrix Reloadofcrapped. They're based on a semblance of a real world. I personally believed they destroyed all of LA in one car chase. Truly the action highlight of the summer.

Complaints will be heard all across the land. But T3 moves, has several good set pieces, a corker of an ending, strong performances, an engaging story, and one of our most beloved icons keeping the whole ship afloat. The whole lithe affair made me hate Matrix Reloaded even more.

title: Spectacular
review:
*Very Minor Spoilers*

Like many others, I didn't know what to expect going into this one, but I truly was blown away. Funny, exciting, well-acted (you know, for a Terminator movie), and with just enough "this is the future of the world" punch to make you realize what this series has always been about.

The lengthy crane chase scene holds its own with any action set piece ever designed, in my opinion, and the sexually charged final battle of the terminators is also quite will done.

It may be "the most expensive B movie ever made", but it's also the first true summer blockbuster in as long as I can remember. 9/10

title: very impressive
review: If i didn't know that a different director filmed this movie as opposed to James Cameron, I never would have been able to tell the difference.  I really enjoy the first two, but this one just takes the cake.  I was so impressed with the special effects and the acting.  Everyone did a great job.  And the end gave me goose bumps.  Three cheers to Jonathan Mostow!

title: Mindless fun
review: If you are looking for plot and oscar winning acting do not go see this movie. If you are looking for a fun summer popcorn movie this will more than fit your needs. There are major plot holes but the special effects and action scenes will make up for it. The effects are much more seamless then the Matrix and the cartoon Neos. The story moves quickly and the ending does not go for the cheap way out. So if you want to have fun go enjoy it and don't think too much.

title: I'm speechless
review: wow..what can I say...T3 just absolutely blew me away.  To all of you who doubted this movie..shame on you guys.  Just the entire movie had me on the edge of my seat..and Kristanna Loken is freakin hot....only 4 words I have to say...Go See It Today

title: Like watching an expensive B Movie.
review:
Spoiler info and personal thoughts in here.

I set my expectations on low just expecting to see more of a continuation of T2. This way I wouldn't be disappointed. That was way too high to set the bar. As much as I love Arnold they couldn't have watched this and thought it was good.

Remote controlling cars from the early part of the movie was an indication of how bad things were going to get. WHY? Totally un-necessary and downright dumb.

Too Many Jokes. He's not human and didn't need so many 80's style one-liners. It was almost like watching the Brady Bunch Movies where they just mock the whole Brady Bunch theme.

Why wasn't she more upset about losing her fiancÃ©? She got over it awfully quick.

There was no need for a romance between the characters.

The truck magically bounces over the girl to hit the terminatrix perfectly. Rewrite that scene. It was painfully dumb.

Better acting on the general's part and some military resistance would have helped. Where were the military personnel?

Why when the police were shooting them in the Hearse did they never hit a window where conners was hiding? Why couldn't he have killed the swat members? He's the Terminator with Barney programming?

The Terminator fights my re-programming scene? Ouch. Very Lame.

More of the Takeover of the machines in the base would have been better. That was your real chance to capitalize on the movie and you have 2 lame fight scenes and its over. And how did conner and the girl get in there so easily? What's with the lame missile through the window with the lamest missile explosion ever? Might as well have been a bottle rocket.

The real question is where did they spend the so-called 180 million?

When did Conner become such a wuss.

I get the feeling this movie was just thrown together and never thought out at all. It's cheesy and dumb. Could have been very good with about a dozen or two changes but just never delivers. Recall the movie now before the weekend and fix it before its reputation is ruined.

title: "Anyone expecting something special is gonna have a real bad day get it."
review:
The first TERMINATOR remains my favorite film ever. The second is right up there. So as far as film going goes these films mean a lot to me. Is it just me or are big films getting worse by the month. Even with hints of decent stories pictures are so rushed now. Special effects, BOOM, special effects, JUMP CUT, F/X GALORE, BOOM...THE END.

I miss the days of the eighties action flicks. Even the early nineties hung in there a bit with TOTAL RECALL, TERMINATOR 2 (despite its morality) and NATURAL BORN KILLERS. My point is these films the good ones, the intense action ones...the fun ones all stuck with violence. Shying away from violence teaches us guns and explosions lack consequence. Not to mention it's all fantasy. We're being taught not to have imagination.

The evolution of film ceases to exist. Technology needs to complement not substitute a story (a la MATRIX RE-LOADED and Terminator 3). Hopefully M. Night or Peter Jackson, or some kid at home writing a great story will inspire us.

It's not all about violence but if you have menacing characters. Please make them convincing.

I wish the Girl-inator beautiful as she was would've kicked some more ass. She arrived only to kill some 50 year old Beverly Hills woman. She should came like Arnold in number one and messed up some gangsters or something. Cliche maybe so, but would've been better than over used one liners and crap.

title: Up there with Hot Shots and Robin Hood men in tights
review: Not really sure the direction the director was heading with the the third installment of the terminator series but definately not anywhere I would have liked it to gone.  It was almost as if Mostow took everything from the previous terminators and made them into a joke in this one.  Yes we all know that the terminator has to find clothes somewhere but the director has to make a joke out of it.  The terminator is a machine.  He would not know whether sunglasses were considered socially feminine.  I dont understand. I sat there and laughed the entire time I was watching the movie.  I wasn't laughing with the director but at just how horrible it was.  The jokes were funny in that way that you laugh because they are incredibly stupid.  Its almost as if it should have been a pg-13 kids movie aside from the swearing and blood.  I am a pretty big fan of the Terminator series, especially the first one, and was very dissapointed.  The first terminator had a very dark, intense style which was lost a little with the second one but still executed.  Everything that was good about the other ones was gone.  The acting was horrible, the plot was simple, and the tone was childish.  The movie is wraught with cheesey one liners and taglines and seemed unable to get passed that.  I feel sorry for James Cameron.  He must be crying right now.  The change is comparable to that Batman series.  Batman and Batman returns were good and then it all just went hollywood corporate.  The thing that suprised me the most was coming online and seeing that it was almost hard to find a bad review.  I guess that what I thought was cool about the first two was not what all the terminator nerds thought was cool. Its worse than what happened to the star wars series.  They thought the jokes were funny and all the talked about were the action sequences.  The first one had very little big budget action but it made up for it in story-line and suspense.  Try watching the first and third movies back to back and you can truly see how stupid the series has gotten.  Oh well, there were a few redeeming scenes that I can hopefully convince myself was worth the 8 bucks. The movie was a big cheesey joke. Don't see this movie unless your a big dork.

title: We didn't want this
review:
How to ruin a great series.

Same stuff. No new liquid metal bad guy. Same FXs as all the current movies.

Force the plot to be common and ruin T2 philosophy. I have the same feeling I had after Matrix Reloaded and Episode I.

Did we really need this?

title: pretty damn good
review:
Most important: it does NOT ruin the series!

I loved it.

The beginning was Terminator trite -- 1 terminator appears, the 2nd appears, he has to get clothes. We've seen it all in the 1st 2 movies. But after that it really took off on its own.

The use of special effects was great. There was SOME useless "shaky cam" shots thrown in there. But mostly, the fight scenes and chase scenes were epic.

I expected to see Arnold, the Terminator, chasing John with a walker. He's not young anymore. But he's still got "it."

Most important for me, I felt like the story progressed. This isn't just another 1 of 20 sequels they'll make. In T3, the story actually moves forward. So if -- IF -- they do make a T4, it'll have to "move on" from here. I was pleased with that.

Be warned: Arnold has more than his share of silly one-liners. This one is definately more light-hearted than the previous movies.

I give it 9/10 -- maybe even 10/10.

title: A grim movie, but could have been great . . .
review:
I have always thought that if a movie isn't worth seeing twice, it isn't worth seeing once. So would I pay my hard-earned scrip to see T3 again? Yes, but only because my wife wants to see it, and couldn't go opening night with the boys and me.

For some reason I was disappointed at the end - but my disappointment is with the ending itself, not because its technical achievements were less than advertised (they weren't).

Obviously, I can't give away the ending here, so I won't. But be forewarned, this is a grim movie, a deeply pessimistic movie. And the first two were not. Thus, the ending was out of synch with the series. I found it jarring. (It's also an extremely obvious setup for Terminator 4, which had darn well better be made because to end the series now would be a travesty.)

That being said, T3 is an amazing piece of movie making. The main chase sequence is a definite contender for the best automotive chase sequence ever; IMO it wins hands down. (I say "automotive" chase because more than cars are used.) The sequence is long, paced just right, exciting and the integration between live action and computer scenes are absolutely seamless.

Arnold S. is back in fighting trim; during final credits a teenage girl in front of us said, upon her mother telling her Arnold is 55, "He looks fine for 55!" Kristanna Loken as the T-X terminator (terminatrix?) performs the role extremely well, although truth be told, there ain't a lot of acting required of her; she utters maybe six sentences in the movie. The rest of the time she simply pursues Arnold, John Conner and Kate Brewster with stolid implacableness. Having a "female" terminator does work well.

Kate Brewster, played by Claire Danes, is John Connor's love interest, although they don't so much as hold hands during the movie. As for her place in the story line, well, you'll have to see for yourself.

At first, I didn't take a shine to Nick Stahl playing John Connor, but before long I changed my mind. He turned out to play the role well.

Finally, Arnold plays the T-101 as, well, only he can. As he explains to Connor shortly after they meet, he is an entirely different machine than the one who saved Connor's bratty skin years before (in T2, Judgment Day, 1991). Unlike in T2, Connor and the T-101 in T3 never "bond" as they did (sort of) in T2. In fact, in T3, Connor tells the T-101 that his predecessor was the only real father figure he ever had - man, Connor led a really screwed up life!

Perhaps because of that, and the fact that sparks never fly between John and Kate, the movie seems mechanical. Okay, it's a movie primarily about two robots, but I'm not a robot and I want humanity for my money. The cast just seemed to be going through their parts like they were following a machine program; I kept waiting for some intensity and depth but it never arrived.

The one exception is Earl Boen's reprise portrayal of Dr. Silberman, he the tormenter of Sarah Connor in T2, the psychiatrist who disbelieved her wild story and confined her to a mental institution indefinitely. But then the two terminators came to the institution, one to kill her, Arnold to save her, and Reality with a Capital R took place right before his eyes.

Well, Silberman is back, and the few minutes his role takes are nearly worth the price of admission by themselves.

Overall, I give T3 six bags of popcorn out of 10, but I give it that many mainly because I really liked the other two, and I like Arnold as well. Otherwise, the whole movie cries out Marlon Brando's famous line in On the Waterfront: "I coulda been a contendah!" So close, and yet so far.

title: Possibly the best of the series, definitely the best movie of summer 2003.
review: I was very impressed with T3.  It is definitely better than T2, and quite possibly even better than the original Terminator.  Of the many movies I've seen this summer, this was by far the best: it is the most well written, has the best action, and even contends for the best humor.  I haven't been this engaged and drawn into a movie since "Fellowship of the Ring" came out a year and a half ago.  The characters are very well written and acted, and the plot remained true to the first two movies.  In fact, I think that the series as a whole makes more sense now that T3 has been added to it.  I would recommend this movie to anyone who is comfortable with the R rating.

title: You've been terminated
review: Though T3 is very competent, it lacks the heart of its 2 predecessors. The film plays like a series of elaborate action scenes (all done very well), with an occasional plot twist thrown in for good measure. Arnold is Arnold, though his quips seemed forced and a bit stale. As for the rest of the cast, they give a workman like effort, yet I felt the film was a bit flat.  I don't necessarily think T3 missed James Cameron, as director Jonathan Mostow has a good eye and films his action sequences with a real amount of flair and some nice bravado.  However, it seemed more of an exercise in excess than actually adding to the terminator franchise. Ultimately the film gives good bang for the buck, but I left feeling cold and uncaring much like the title's namesake.

title: Action Packed, a MUST SEE
review: Finally -- A sequel, or the third to the series, that actually rocks!  I walked in the theater expecting to be disappointed.  I was way wrong!  The humor, action, and storyline was fantastic.  It doesn't get hokey or stupid, it keeps with the theme.  Spoiler: Looks like T4 is on the way!!!

title: Doesn't compare to the first 2, but still fun
review: Comparing this to the originals is a no win situation. It's inferior to both, but still a solid entry. It may irk some fans with the direction it goes, but overall...if you like action and some great Terminator lines then I think you'll enjoy it. I feared this movie would be a total piece of garbage, so my expectations weren't high. Because I wasn't anticipating a "bar raising" entry into the series I think it allowed me to enjoy it for what it was. It's Terminator Light...less thought goes into it and the pacing just screams forward. The frantic pace actually helps distract you from the problems with the script/plot. It's all about the action and nostalgic humor. You will have fun when you see this, but don't expect anything resembling the masterpiece of T2 that Cameron crafted. Oh, and Kristanna Loken is easily the hottest robot that has ever graced film...and she is entirely believable in her role.

title: Only average if you haven't seen the first two movies!!!
review:
I just got done watching T3 and at best it was brutal, I love the first two movies and this doesn't even compare, CAMERON WHERE ARE YOU!!!!, I just want to know how did they get away with destroying the franchise like this, All true fans of the series will see this movie as nothing else but a few descent action scenes and waste of 170 million dollars. It's a sad day if your a fan of the series they just KILLED IT !!

My Rating 5/10 , just because I'm such a fan of the first two!!!

title: Funniest action movie
review: I think it's Anie's great return, as much as unbelievable Mostow's success. Funny, pure entertainment. All that jokes, addressed to first and second flicks lovers (and some other Carolco-films) are so kind, that's impossible to be angry about it. In some places it's like video-game, times it's looks like original "Planet of the Apes", but it's good way to start 'T4'. Two thumbs up!

title: Good, but not as great as T2!!!
review: A good sequel to a long running, and quite extraordinary saga. Arnold still maintains his physique and "terminator-style" attitude. I particularly was really impressed with the CGI and special effects. A must see for die-hard "Terminator" and Arnold fans alike.

title: (Possible Spoiler) Special Effects were very good
review:
After 12 years the FX has been improved over T2. It is not as good as T2, however it will still be one of the biggest movies of the summer. Arnold paid $1.4 mil. for one of the scenes that was to be cut due to budget. The movie was full of action from the start, however the ending was disapointing. John Conner is not as strong a character as he was in T2.

(Warning following may contain plot spoilers) . . . .

T3 is very similar to the Original 1984 version in overal plot and ending. There may be a T4 in the future?

title: Not as good as T2 but better than the first
review: T3 is the third best movie I've seen this summer (make that year, so far) after "X2" and "The Hulk," both of which were separated from the rest of the summer movie flock by their unusual amounts of depth and character detail. T3 on the other hand, lacks such depth, but, really, who needs it, with Jonathan Mostow's exciting, fast-paced direction and one of Arnold's best performances he's given since... T2. Although Cameron's films were sci-fi action movies that were based on ideas and frightening social commentary, T3 is more or less, simply, a popcorn action movie that rarely stops to ask the question "Why," or more importantly "How?". Occasionally this is distracting, and compared to T2, the storyline's twists and turns here are child's play. But the movie is directed and written with so much fun and flair, and with an experimental "balls-out" style of humor I found surprisingly appealing. Who could've thought Arnold's Terminator character could be so funny without losing any of its menace, mysteriousness, or power? Special thanks goes to Arnold, who's perfected these sort of movies, and director Mostow for not going too light and keeping an air of menace and doom near the unusual (yet somewhat rushed) finale. As far as cast replacements go, I thought Nick Stahl did a fine job replacing Edward Furlong as John Connor. Stahl gives the character some depth and interest that Furlong could never provide. As for Linda Hamilton, the movie gives us a rational explanation for her departure and I really didn't miss her all that much. This is John's story, not Sarah's. Claire Danes was decent as the romantic interest, although I think we could've had a few more scenes that would've made her character seem more... important. As for the female Terminator, she's a hot babe no doubt, but nowhere near the menace of Robert Patrick's T-1000 or Arnold's earlier evil Terminator, but she makes a good match for Arnold and certainly raises some eyebrows. Overall, T3 would probably have been better with Cameron's touch, but I think Mostow did an excellent job with it, I haven't had this much true FUN at the movies in a while, and I recommend you go see it if only for entertainment value. ***1/2 out of ****.

title: Rise of the Cash Machines
review:
After viewing The Matrix Reloaded I overheard someone saying they liked the film but that there was too much talking. Sounds like today's generation just wants their movies to be stylized video games. Lots of action, easy to follow plots, and emotions not included. We give you T3. Yes, the film has tremendous action

sequences, lots of one line jokes and mediocre performances. The TX is stunning as is any hot girl on the cover of the latest magazine at your local newsstand. The T-1000 on the other hand is memorable because the actor portraying him is

talented. Only two things sustained this film: 1. The action (which is supplied in tons this summer on various films) 2. The first two films and their story lines. Audience wants to know what happens to these characters because the first two films made an impact; created a longing; set up a plot worth dissecting. The T3 just threw money and ideas in the air and knew the franchise would bring in the hordes. Producers made this film, not Filmmakers (some Producers do care about film as an art, just not in this film). Louder, Bigger, Faster doesn't necessarily mean

Better. Rehash the two prior stories into one and you get Terminator 3. The end was only good because it was a given; a set up for another sequel: Rise of the Cash Machines. In the end it is only a movie and it is only money. If we don't value money then we don't value what we buy with it. If we don't expect a good film then we settle for ordinary, something to pass the time. Time, something else we must not value when wasted on formulaic, predictable, and uneventful films. I expect more, my time is precious and I work hard for my money. Therefore I will invest it into DVD's of films of an earlier more creative era. I'll start by watching The Terminator and then follow that with T2. I know for sure that they stand the test of time. Wonder if T3 will too?

title: Worth Seeing - Could have been better.
review:
I'll try my best to keep this spoiler free:

THE GOOD: The two terminators - Arnold knows exactly how to play this character. He manages to make Terminator likeable, even amusing. (Why not? Everyone knows ahead of time that he's a hero.) Still, he never lets us forget that he's a super-badass killing machine. Pretty good trick for a guy in his mid 50s :)

Kristanna Loken, while not quite as menacing as Robert Patrick was in T2 (Who is?), nevertheless does a fine job. She is extremely sexy, and yet, I never took her lightly. Also, I enjoyed those little bits of emotion that the director allows her show. I've been waiting a long time for a Terminator that actually ENJOYS killing, and can get excited at the prospect of finding an unexpected target.

The T-X is a great concept... in theory. Combining both of the previous variants (T-1000-ish shapeshifting metal, covering an armed-to-the-teeth skeleton) is a logical extrapolation of the idea, and COULD have made her the most frightening Terminator yet.

The action scenes involving Terminator and/or T-X were outstanding. Terrific fight scenes, particularly the "bathroom" fight, and the end of the truck-vs.-mobile-crane chase scene.

There are a few parts of the movie that genuinely surprised me. I honestly didn't see the ending coming. (In hindsight, I should have.) Also, the explanation of how this particular Terminator came into the the human resistance's possession... Without spoiling anything, let's just say that it was quite chilling.

THE ADEQUATE: This may be a matter of opinion, but I thought the T-X died a little too quickly and too easily, particularly for such potent villain.

The human leads - John Connor (Nick Stahl), Kate Brewster (Claire Danes), General Brewster (David Andrews), etc. were OK, but that's all they were. None of them were able to dominate a scene like Kyle Reese (Michael Biehn) and Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton). These humans NEEDED Arnold on their side to make them interesting.

It's the script's fault, not Nick Stahl's, but I'd hoped for more, much much more, from John Connor. In T2, Sarah Connor was absolutely larger-than-life (albeit insane); I could easily imagine Skynet fearing her. In this movie, we only see faint glimpses of that from John Connor, and IMHO that wasn't enough.

The action scenes that didn't include either Terminator or T-X were relatively weak. Not horrible, but not particularly memorable either.

The film is generally lighter than the previous two, both literally and figuratively. Fewer critical scenes took place at night, and there was more humor. This is both good and bad. The jokes generally worked, thanks largely to Arnold's deadpan delivery, and this movie didn't look or feel like a carbon copy of the previous two, as it easily could have. Still, much of the sense of urgency was lost.

THE BAD: The T-X's capabilities, in practice, were inconsistently written, and sometimes distracted from the story. For example, how can she remotely drive four cars? Even if she is a super-whiz-bang computer, something in the cars has to physically push the pedals and turn the steering wheels.

How can she "infect" a computer system that doesn't have any modems or interfaces? I think Arnold says something about "nanotechnology" but that drifts a little too far into technobabble.

How does T-X mimic complex machines? Sure, I can imagine her having a blaster and a few critical power tools stored in her skeleton. However, I simply cannot accept her being able to turn her limbs into flame throwers, complicated gizmos, etc.

I'll usually overlook technical details (these are just movies), but not when those details make it difficult for me to suspend my disbelief. Furthermore, none of those capabilities helped to advance the plot in any meaningful way; all could easily have been been written out. The basic concept behind the T-X is more than adequate, without resorting to magic tricks.

Additionally, as other reviewers have mentioned, there are significant plot holes. I won't repeat or describe them here, since they'd be spoilers, but holes do exist. I'm anxious to see the deleted scenes when this movie comes out on DVD; It might help to explain things a bit better.

Finally, as others have said, Linda Hamilton is sorely missed. I don't know why she wasn't included in T3, but hope that the choice was hers, and hers alone. If the producers didn't want her, or if they decided that her asking price was too high, bad call.

CONCLUSION: I enjoyed T3, I'm glad I saw it, and I'll see it again. However I'll probably wait until it makes it's way to a second-run theater (ie. reduced ticket price). Once at full price is enough.

Bottom line - Terminator and T2 were two of the all-time great movies. T3 was a very good popcorn movie (particularly during this very disappointing year) but it lacked greatness.

title: Action Packed
review: In my opinion, I think this movie was full of action. In the first forty-five minutes they demolished something like thirty cars, a couple of buildings and tore up a piece of the street. There was never a dull moment, the plot was very good for a sequel, the way they used Claire Danes character was brilliant, and the ending was great.

title: Fantastic!
review: When I first heard that there was going to be another Terminator movie (T3), I cringed. I couldn't possibly imagine how they could explain there way out of how the last one ended. All of SkyNet had been destroyed with the last terminator, so in my mind there was no need for another movie. But I went anyway; I couldn't pass up on the chance that it would be worth seeing. And I was NOT disappointed at all; this movie was one of my top ten movie experiences. The movie had incredible special effects, as you would expect, without being over the top to the point of disbelief. The action was non-stop, realistic, and supported the movie. There were no useless action scenes, just to have action. The acting wasn't as bad as I thought it would be, in fact I thought it was well acted. Being an action movie there wasn't a lot of dialog but when there was the actors sold their parts very well. Overall, I would say this is a great flic, worth the price of admission, and something that I will see again in the theater. I highly recommend it. 9\10

title: Better than I expected!
review:
I like action movies. Not the imitation skinflick, straight to the video store, foreign crap we often get. I like red-meat-eatin' heros who can take it as well as dish it out.

Arnold does that. Well.

And, unlike so many other of his so-called "peers", he's not afraid to get his character's face messed up. He is good and he knows it.

Now the movie is really a comic book story, a better than anime drama about humans struggling against machines (both corporate and steel), a regular pile of doggy doo--except that these actors and actresses pull it out of the toilet, polish it up and make it the movie of the summer that you'll NEED to see again.

And, at just under 2 hours, you and your friends/family won't mind seeing it more than once.

Do it. Go see it today!!

title: Some Cheap Jokes
review: I was quite impressed with the plot line of this film and would reccomend that anyone who is a fan of the series go to see it.  If the fourth is produced this sets it up well.  There were some things in the movie that were there for cheap laughs, but they are tolerable if you like the plot.

title: Missing Key Elements
review:
This movie is typical of a sequel, it is not as good as the original(s). There are certain things missing from this movie that the first two have, such as the terror of interacting with the Terminator. The script is reduced to a string of one liners, which are cute, but overdone.

Overall, this movie is worth seeing, the stunt work and special effects are excellent, but don't expect it to be at the same level of the first two.

title: god...what a great film.
review:
I liked T1.....really liked T2 (loved T-1000) but when I saw the trailer for this I was really bummed out. Then I saw the UK trailer and sparked some interest.

I love Arnold and let me be the first to saw "This movie is FANTASTIC" From Special Effects, to Music (awesome), Story, acting and tension......it was all done fantastically (Oh did I mention HUMOR?)

The T-X sent shivers down my spine by the way she so many people like it was nothing. The Original Terminator and T-1000 only killed when they had to or just when they were annoyed by someone. The TX kills EVERYTHING that she sees.

Arnold is back and I hope hes ready for part 4. The way they would talk about T2 was great: "Oh man....so I have to teach you everything again?"

The entire theatre was a riot as everyone laughed so hard at Arnold's expertly executed humor. There are many scenes that are touching and powerfully delivered (when Arnie goes beserk) The ending was the best of the series as you were literally either screaming or just at the edge of your seat. I cant wait for T-4. Looks like the series is finally going to be in the future.

(Also special props to Claire Daines and Staln for doing such a great job and proving the world wrong) And special props for T-X for being so hot.

***********SPOILER***************

Best line of movie

Arnie: "Are you hurt?" Connor: "Im fine" (Arnie bangs on window leading to back of van)

Arnie" Catherine, have you sustained injury?"

Catherine: "Drop dead you F****** Piece of Sh**" (Arnie shuts window)

Arnie: "I am unable to comply"

title: Arnie's Best performance ever
review: Except for a few scenes, where the art direction is not up to the "Terminator series" class,  the movie has excellent entertainment value. The movie has got excellent special effects and minimal chit-chat as in the 2 prequels. The Terminatrix "Kristanna Loken" has done a decent job, but this was clearly the best performance by Arnie after a long time. Nick Stahl and Claire Danes are not very impressive, but we have to keep in mind that all the action is packed in just 1:48 hrs. The movie ends well with all bases covered. All in all, a perfect action movie with more new and funny one-liners!!

title: good tricks and not hacked
review: The reason that the machines still exist is not hacked together like magical fairies or a wizard did it. There are a few good ironic situations,can you say Elton John HA HA. There are a few unanswered questions not anything that would make the movie incomplete but some things that would make it come together better.

title: A worthy sequel to a winding down franchise.
review:
CONTAINS MILD SPOILERS I expected to go to this movie and be extremely disappointed with it. The original director/writer James Cameron was missing, Arnold was getting caught up by his age, and it's been over a decade since T2. Instead I was actually quite satisfied with Jonathan Mostows take on Terminator.

I thought that the character acting was quite well done. Nick Stahl wasn't exactly powerful with his performance as John Connor but this was a good thing because it seemed that the focus of the film was no longer on him anyways. Claire Danes while making a wonderful damsel in distress didn't really convince me that she was to be a key lieutenant of the future but I guess that's how Linda Hamilton's character was in the first film so it's all the more intriguing. Arnold's performance was of course perfect. He easily recaptured the Terminator persona and was even able to pull off some good humor with a straight face. Kristanna Loken's terminator did her job but wasn't really as intimidating as the original T-800 or the T-1000. Maybe because it was a woman this time I don't know. It's most likely the fact that I had the phrase "been there done that" echoing in my head since we all knew Arnold would win in the end.

The plot was probably the weakest category of this film. Unlike T2 there wasn't really any good sub-plot to keep the viewer intrigued between explosions. However luckily the key pressure points and a surprise twist ending kept things interesting. Some claim this is just a rip-off of movies like the Matrix because it involves computers taking over the world. Those hippie Matrix fan boys should not be listened to since this has been the key concept for the last 19 years of the franchise!

As for the action, some may complain it's pretty much the same as T2. Why is this a bad thing!? The chase scene alone was enough to give any action fan their fix. Anyone who says otherwise probably doesn't believe the phrase "if it ain't broke, don't fix it."

Overall, I definitely recommend this film. Though not as strong as the first two films, it still kept the Terminator franchise on its feet and had decent entertainment value. It could have been worse and completely spoil the series like a certain three prequel films from a certain popular space fighting franchise from far, far away. If this is the last film, it didn't end with a bang but with a solid satisfying march out the door. If T4 is made then at least T3 held the bridge up instead of letting it crash down. 3 out of 5.

title: it all depends on what you were expecting
review:
ok, so we all love T2, and the original was ok, but I think there is something to be said for the new installment of the terminator series.

I'm going to start off by saying that I Hate CG, but the makers of T3 used it very well in most scenes, some times i even wondered if i was watching something real, or a cartoon, and other times it was obvious, but that's not the point. it's still 12 times better than a certain star wars that will remain nameless.

the only thing i'm wondering about is why they couldn't get Edward Furlong to play the older John Conner. Nick Stahl (who inherited the role) does a close to awful job as the main character, next to Claire Daines, who actually does pretty well with the part she's given. Arnold returns as the Title role; he's been doing the part for so long that i think he's finally got it down.

like 7 out of 9 movies playing at the theatre right now, T3 is a sequel or a remake. one of the big problems with making a sequel or a remake is that the film makers feel as though they must pay homage to the orginals, with things that turn out no better that a pun. i feel that the movie was a little caught up in it's sequel-ness; with lines like "she'll be back." and other scenes that were remeniscent of the first 2.

I give it a C- maybe a C. for an action movie, it was ok. for a sequel it was good. acting was pretty bad, but i can over look that. to come up with the final grade.

title: Good action, but found the story lacking
review: Great stunts through out the movie, but even though there was lots of action I didn't like how the movie went a little cheesy.  "Talk to the hand", was funny, but didn't belong.   And the ending was terrible.  I guess they will look at making number 4 so we will finally see the battle of man versus machine in the future.

title: Worthwhile
review:
This is in response to the review that stated:

"Obviously made to capitalize on the Matrix/cyber world popularity that movie companies no doubt see as an opportunity for a quick buck. Besides computers (machines) taking over being an obvious rip off of the Matrix/Animatrix, T3 steals from the Hulk (rebuilding nano-technology) and Men in Black II (sexy woman villain)."

This movie's release is in line with the every 10 years (give or take) schedule that the second one followed. How can the theme of computers taking over be a ripoff of the Matrix, when the theme existed in the first Terminator movie, 20 years ago? Nano-technology type stuff has been in Sci-Fi for at least ten years and I think sexy female villains have been around for a long time before Men in Black II.

Not that this movie is a terribly original one. It doesn't rip off any more than any other movie.

Personally, I found it was worthwhile to watch. It is, I am sure, much easier to like if you were a big fan of the first two. At any rate, it was fun to watch. There were some idiotic scenes, like the one in the hangar, towards the end. But there was not enough bad about it to make me regret seeing it.

title: A wild ride
review: Although, I was skeptical before going to see this film, the movie proved I was worrying needlessly. Everything that made the previous movies wonderful was right there yet again. Action, thrills, plot twists, some humor, and plenty of heart stopping moments. The characters were interesting and three dimensional, and one could not help becoming concerned about their fates. The movie was also intelligent, requiring the viewer to stop and consider new concepts and ideas. There were a few continuity errors with the timeline, but all in all, Terminator 3 is one wild ride well worth watching.

title: If you love the license.....don't see it.
review: I'm both a big Terminator fan and both a James Cameron fan, and him not directing really shows in this movie. The action was average at best (and for some of you that have written that the crane scene in Terminator 3 was better than the highway scene from The Matrix : Reloaded.......right) The story, while it did fit into the trilogy, wasn't really elaborated on. The comedy was funny, but very out of place for this kind of movie. And Arnold didn't have many lines besides his catch phrases. It looks like this movie was thrown together in one sitting, with the sole purpose of just making money off the public, and not to get a quality movie out for the people that have been waiting over a decade for it.

title: Why is Everyone Comparing This Movie To T2 ?
review: I have seen this movie, and I Thought it was the greatest Terminator yet. This movie stands out on its own and should not be compared to T2 or The original Terminator. This Movie was more Heart Pounding, Gut Wrenching, and Hilarious Than The Other Ones. "Who Cares if James Cameron had nothing to do with this Movie ?" I Admit, I was a little Upset that They Didn't Even Mention Poor old Reese, But i will live. I Give This Movie a Hell Yeah, so go and see it Right Now !!!

title: Great Summer Fun
review: When the Terminator 3 was first advertised I thought it was the end of Arnold's career. After seeing the movie last night I was totally wrong! It had everything that a summer movie should have. It was action packed from reel to reel with a great ending that makes you think. The majority of critics are bashing the writing and director of this film. I thought that the movie was above average compared to the garbage that is now playing. The T-X was very creepy just like the T2 villain. This movie does fine without Cameron who is hailed by others as a god like director. I did not even miss the squeaky E. Furlong. This movie is balls out action film! That is what it was meant to be not an Oscar winner. Price of ticket well spent. The movies that Ebert gives bad reviews are the films I see and love. Movies are meant to entertain and not to be taken so seriously.

title: This move rocks!!!I mean rocks!!!
review: If you read some reviews that said this movie sucks,don't listen to them. I seriously liked this move alot!!!Great special effects nice acting and cool fighting scenes!This movie on a scale of 1 to 10,I gave it a ten!I really recommend this move!It really is great to have Arnold back!Though,the only flaw of this move is that it is not as brutal as the first 2 terminator movies!But,theres a seen where T-X punches threw a cop!And few other brutal scenes.This indeed is one of the best movies of summer!Rated R for Strong sci-fi action and violence,and for Language and Brief nudity.

title: Pure crap
review:
As a huge Terminator fan, I rushed to see the sneak preview of T3 on Tuesday, July 1. This movie was a mess. Nick Stahl, while a talented actor, was just not cut out for this role. Also, there was way too much product placement. The magic of the first two is gone forever. The Terminator series has turned into predictable Hollywood crap. While I wasn't crazy about the softening up and kid-friendliness of Arnold in T2, the intensity and energy of that film was undeniable and kept you at the edge of your seat. This element was absent in T3. Stahl and Clair Danes just didn't contribute enough of an emotional element to carry the story. T1 was a landmark in action/sci fi films. T3 is just typical Hollywood. I have to hand it to James Cameron. He jumped off this sinking ship just in time. (no Titanic jokes please!)

P.S When did they start making Cyborgs with facelifts and nose jobs?

title: 4th of July BANG!!!
review:
Wow!!! By far the best Terminator Movie!!! If you forget the fact that one and two were ground breaking then as the story goes this was the best one. Arnold looked bad ass! and this movie rocked. If this make 300 million plus world wide that means look for Terminator 4 sometime soon.

Movie includes 1. One of the top 5 car chase sceans of all time!! 2. Best Destruction from Nuculear war visuals. 3. One of the top 5 scenes at skynet. 4. One of the best cliff hanger endings!! So dont listen to any crap review you might read or think this film might be a let down and go out to a theatre and watch and be amazed again!!!!!!

title: Wow! Much better than I expected, good film!
review:
I went to see T3 with moderate expectations but halfway through the film I found myself really impressed with the third Terminator film.

As expected, T3 has lots of action but much of it is done well in conveying the story. There is an especially intense vehicle chase and it's been a while since I've watch one on film that didn't bore me to some extent. I've read some reviews that complained that T3 didn't show off a lot of special effects and seemed-scaled back. This is not the case of all. One of the good things about T3 is that it doesn't bombard you with lots of CGI and other effects. And some of the effects here are quite impressive.

T3 also has quite a bit of humor especially in the first half of the film. I wasn't expecting this as much but it was fun and it did a good job of balancing against action.

The ending of the film is perhaps the best asset. It stays true to the first Terminator film and leaves you thinking about dangers technology going amok and the value of life.

T3 is more a enjoyable action, sci-fi film than the Matrix Reloaded and in many ways better than T2.

title: Loved it ...
review:
I've seen mixed reviews everywhere, and understandably so. This is perhaps one of the most hyped-films of the year (right next to Hulk and Return of the King), and quite a few less-than-promising factors involved (no James Cameron, no Sarah Connor).

But let's get to the point: Was it a great action flick? Absolutely. Does it make significant headway into the SkyNet storyline? Definitely? Did the audience cheer? Oh yes.

Nit-picky details aside, this movie continued to build, build, build (in a wonderful array of action sequences than truly put you in the seat of danger, and in developing the new characters). It climaxes with the inevitable activation of SkyNet, and leaves you wanting more in the end.

Great movie. Perhaps I am not a professional reviewer, but I am anxiously anticipating T4.

title: Good Addition to series(No spoilers)
review:
A worthy follow up to the series. Great ending. No spoilers from me.

Liked. The action sequences. Claire Danes and Nick Stahl. Arnold's one liners were funny but he is not as good in this as T2 which he was more complex(if a terminator can be so)

Dislike. Thought it needed to be a little longer. Not enough back story to explain why this was going on again.

Overall grade B+

title: Good, but like stripped down version of Terminator 1 & 2
review: I thoroughly enjoyed the movie, but since it is the third in the list of "Parts", then it had to suffer the inevitable problem of having the plot already explained in the previous movies.  Other than that, it was a rollercoaster ride, and it could have used Camerins magical touch and more plot.  It was mostly a wow factor movie.

title: quite a surprise
review: With little hype and a bad promotional campaign, I expected a jank movie...boy, was I wrong. The special effects are amazing, the TX is 100% bad-ass and the fight scenes are drool-worthy. I even thought the story was well written (for an action movie). I consider this a worthy follow-up.

title: Saved by the Story. James Cameron, where are you?
review:
T3 suffers from the "Matrix Syndrome," the need to outdue and surpass its predecessors with bigger, bolder, more blast-worthy action. Chases and nitroglycerine abound in this film as characterization is pushed to the background.

To be fair, very little characterization is needed except for the Claire Danes character. Unless you've been living in an isolated commune for the past 20 years, you know the Terminator. Arnold's persona has become pop culture myth -- like the Six Million Dollar Man writ large. Stahl's character, John Connor, is still the ordinary man tormented by his awesome destiny.

T3 does deliver the stunts, the explosions, even the catchy one-liners to which we've become accustomed. Arnold's performance is stellar. His charm breathes humanity into an automaton (Gov. Schwarzenegger one day perhaps?). Stahl is competent, while Danes is immeasurably underused. Note her role as Juliet in Baz Luhrman's Romeo and Juliet -- but hey, this isn't Henry James. Kristanna Loken is good as well, sexily exuding VERY homicidal tendencies.

Yet beyond the action, T3 main point of interest is the story. While the first 2 films touch upon existentialism and self-determination ("There's no fate but what you make" is a recurring theme), this film does a 180 and focuses on destiny. The ending is intriguing, a little 12 Monkeys-que, and certainly depressing.

I agree with Roger Ebert in saying that T3 is really a dumbed down version of its history. Were it not for the creative ending, I probably wouldn't have been as impressed. That said, T3 is a worthy addition to the franchise.

title: Whoa! This is couldn't really happen... could it?
review:
This the best Terminator movie.

The action and movement of the movie is excellent. There are a

few mistakes and maybe some liberty is taken with some of the

action, but they do not take anything from the chase or the fights. I

still don't understand the scene with the magnetic field, but will try

to stretch my imagination still a little more to make sense of it.

Arnold is not as impressive looking as he was in the earlier

movies, but he still has muscles even if they may not be as big as

they used to be. The ending makes a lot of sense and leaves the

idea wide open for more sequels or a series.

The doctor from the earlier Terminator movies makes an

appearance which is funny and I wished they used him just a bit

more, but his exit was great comic relief. Arnold did not seem to

have any new quotes, but I got the feeling this will be the last time

we will see this version of the Terminator. Maybe Big Lou (The real

Incredible Hulk) will continue with a version.

This movie also teaches that one should be really, REALLY careful

what one says "Yes" to.

title: Arnold came back with a vengeance!
review: I didn't know what to expect i knew it would be cool but i didn't think it would be great but i was wrong the cast did a good job stahl played conner better than furlong because there wasn't all that whinning dont get me wrong t2 is better but this was a worthy sequel. the ending was great judgement day happened no matter what they did. a 4th installment would be interesting but they should end it with three. some of the lines were iffy but they didn't hurt the movie what so ever i enjoyed it i hope you will too.

title: FORGET IT.
review: Read "The Sun Also Rises" instead, if you must.  NOTHING HAPPENS.  This movie is nothing but one big monster truck rally, just without the oversized tires.  And mysogynist to boot--instead of the dogged fighter we had in Linda Hamilton, this time around we get the female terminator that disarms her victims by enhancing her boobs, and the Clare Danes character with absolutely no purpose in the story but to stick by her man's side and fulfil his destiny.

title: FUN-FILLED WILD RIDE
review:
At last! the return of an outrageous, rambunctious, tightly paced and funny adventure flick that doesn't take itself too seriously and doesn't mind being a self-parody.

I am so grateful that T3 does not get bogged down with the hokey mysticism of the new `Star Was' trilogy, the pseudo-techno babble of `The Matrix', and the sappy self-indulgent New Age-ism of the "Star Trek" series.

It's just a good old beat-em-up, shoot-em-up yarn with a simple theme: artificial intelligent machines hate us and they're relentlessly bent on killing us. Period.

Without getting itself sidetracked on boring detail, this trilogy finally acknowledges that the past can't be changed. All the characters are trapped in a time-paradox -- something awkwardly glossed-over in the dismal `Time Machine' remake.

Arnold will go down in history as making more money per spoken word than any actor since silent films. His one-liners are devastating. What more does a robot have to say? The choice of a female Terminator was inevitable, and pretty Kristanna Loken really plays it straight with a chilling determination.

title: Move over Edward Furlong,,,,Nick is in TOWN!!
review: This movie was entertaining.  It was not a SUPER GOOD action movie though. There were a lot of good points.  I didn't mind that kid who played John Conner.  I don't think he looked like Reese at all.  I did like the way he stayed STRONG even when the CHIPS were down.  What I did like about this movie was that ARNOLD didn't seem to need any steroids.  He still looks STRONG and said he worked out for THREE hours a day to TRAIN for this movie. That's odd, considering that he was only exposed for 30 seconds with no SHIRT.  However, since it's Arnold, I don't mind.  What I hated, was that Arnold didn't ask for himself to be made a better CYBORG.  If he is a TIME TRAVELER, he could have gone way forward into time and asked for the scientists to make him STRONGER so that he could beat the Terminatrix.  That was a HUGE flaw in the movie.   The OTHER flaw was CLAIR DAINES.  Is she supposed to marry JOHN CONNER and HAVE KIDS?  I hate to say it, but Reese already had a child with Sarah Conner.  The odds of a child being produced after a NUCLEAR WAR are very minimal.  The fallout alone would KILL all the reproductive organs.  I was SHOCKED to see how much Clair Daines has AGED. She AGED very well though.  It was EXACTLY LIKE Linda Hamilton when she became angry with the Terminatrix.    What about where Arnold carried a coffin?  Did you find it STRANGE that the bullets didn't penetrate his LEATHER JACKET?  That was not well thought out.   Also, when The Terminatrix was attracted to a LARGE MAGNET, she got a circular saw out and SAWED the magnetic tube.  The tube would have been so MAGNETICALLY strong, that the circular saw would not have worked!!  Why didn't they show how she got out of that PREDICAMENT?  I found it strange that Termintrix was able to drive that CRANE as long as she did.  I have seen CRANES and they don't go that fast.  They also do NOT have the power to go through as many buildings as it did.  The Terminator girl was good though.  She could have become invisible and been way more effective.  If she has the ability to copy anybody, she should copy INVISIBLE,,,,that would have been the way to go.  Sure, a few flaws in this movie, but ARNOLD delivered a few good lines and the best line was when he said "DON'T DO THAT".  What I am wondering, is who will play JOHN CONNER in the next TERMINATOR?  My money is on Rick Schroeder or Paul Reiser.  Noodle Juice man would be good. also.

title: A Unworthy and less than stellar "comedy"... Not The REAL Terminator.
review: You know in the last 10 years American film making has suffered horribly in the way that it plays up movie clichés, and things that are perceived as comic relief, this film serves as a prime example of how to take a no brainer and mock what you are actually trying to accomplish. The first problem comes in that Arnold is no longer just a caricature of himself in the publics minds, but now he's a caricature of that caricature in the movie itself if that makes any sense. Having him spout off one liners just for the sake of one liners is really sad, and unlike the typical "comic relief" that pollutes films now days its was way overdone in the first hour or so almost to the point I was feeling embarrassed as a fan of the series. It was almost like they were trying to make you forget they actually had a real struggle in the movie and that the t-850 was there to be a joke, hell if that was the case why didn't they just hire Rob Schneider as the threat? LISTEN UP HOLLYWOOD some of us LOVE these kinds of films, why "fix" what's not broken??? Comic relief is fine if used right, but as this film goes it was poorly wrote and badly placed. The TX or Terminatrix was pretty lame as well, but much of that had to do with the way she was shot, and not just how bad her acting was... simply put she did not come across as a cold blooded killer like Arnie or Robert Patrick did. The idea of exploiting her femininity to murder is one thing, but they way it was handled is another as the "Victoria's secret" scene was made for 10 year olds it would seem. Why the hell would a damn near invincible "pull over" for a cop anyway? That really made sense... To have a unproven like Jonathan Mostow direct in Cameron's leave is just ridiculous, the guys a damned hack pure and simple if he can ruin something so good, especially trimming the film down under 2 hours like a good "commercial" director. For all the negativity though I will say it had SOME redeeming things going for it, the first of which is Nick Stahl. Stahl was TREMENDOUS in the movie and in many ways the glue that held it together for the first hour, unlike the terrible actor (Edward Furlong) that portrayed him in T2, he had depth and appeal. The last 30 mins are pretty good (even if the Terminator battle was eh...) and the ending gave me chills... Too bad this film was so badly soiled by its directors hand and the poor script, it could have been great 5/10 (Mainly due to Stahl's outstanding performance)

title: Awesome car chase... lame ending (semi-spoilers)
review:
The breath-taking car chase with the TX and her crane bearing down on the hapless Toyota Tundra had me blurting more than a few "ouch" and explitive comments. A good car chase, however, does not make a movie. Yes, it did have a few good plot points and I did enjoy the subtle humouros allusions to the first two movies... especially the PTSD counsellor.

What didn't work for me? Arnold's obviously computer generated chest, and the LAME ending that basically says "If you want to know the really ending to this story you have to wait for Terminator 4."

The last movie that pulled this cheap shot was "Back to the Future II." Cliffhangers like this suck and are an insult to movie fans.

title: Action to spare, but lacks heart and Cameron's touch
review: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines (2003) D: Jonathan Mostow. Arnold Schwarzeneggar, Nick Stahl, Claire Danes, Kristanna Loken, David Andrews, Earl Boen, Moira Harris, M.C. Gainey, Susan Merson. As it turns out, the 1997 nuclear war prevented in TERMINATOR 2: JUDGMENT DAY had not been prevented at all, just merely postponed. Taking place in the present day, yet another Terminator, the T-X (Loken) is sent back through time to kill the future leader of the human resistance John Connor (Stahl, filling in for the troubled Edward Furlong), as well as several other future military leaders. The long awaited TERMINATOR sequel lacks director James Cameron and stars Linda Hamilton and Furlongand it shows. Despite some great action sequences by director Mostow (who won me over with 1997's BREAKDOWN) and great special effects, the film fails to capture its audience with awe and wonder like the first two. Several twists about the actual war caused by Skynet (talked about in the first two films but never actually shown) are present here and are a neat touch. However, Loken's T-X isn't nearly as menacing as Robert Patrick's T-1000 in T2. Action to spare, but lacks heart and Cameron's touch. Also, the music score by Marco Baltrami just plain sucks (omitting Brad Fiedel's famous TERMINATOR theme until a lousy orchestrated version at the film's end). RATING: 7 out of 10. Rated R for graphic violence, profanity, and brief nudity.

title: The best of this year's summer blockbusters.
review:
**** out of ****

I feared the worst for Terminator 3.
